column1: starts with an extremely wide length ball, swings away from Amla, who leaves it alone
much better. Angles it into the fourth-stump line and gets it to curl away late. Amla lets it swing and defends with soft hands towards backward point
similar line, Amla defends again
wider line to try and tempt Amla into a drive away from his body. He sees the amount of outswing on it and resists the temptation
fuller, closer to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
wide-ish outswinger once more, gets some pretty steep bounce too, from a fullish length, and Amla leaves again
short, the first time he's lost his length this over, and Amla punishes him with a back-foot slap to the point boundary
shortish, slanting away from off stump, reaches out to tap it away through the point region
ooh, extra bounce in the corridor outside off stump. Amla gets off his feet and fends at it, and he's lucky the ball doesn't kiss his gloves on its way to the keeper
overpitched, wide, and Amla says thank you, opens his bat face to drive it forcefully to the point boundary
oh, even better. Not quite as full as the previous one, and he holds his shape and meets it right under his eye to drive on the up, between cover and mid-off
back of a length, good bounce again in the corridor. Rides the bounce and dabs it down to third man
back of a length, angling across to off stump. De Kock plays with soft hands, looking for a quick single into the off side, but the man at point moves in quickly to cut the ball off
back of a length, close to off stump, defended to backward point
well played. Good length, angling in towards off stump. This one doesn't swing away, and Amla watches it all the way and defends with a lovely vertical bat, back down the pitch towards the bowler
second wide for Lakmal today. Loses his action a little, I think, and the ball starts swinging as soon as it leaves his hand, and ends up pretty short and very wide outside off stump
good length, fifth-stump line, left alone
width again, and Amla reaches out and carves it away, up and over the vacant cover point region
back of a length outside off, gets on his toes and punches it to the left of backward point. Third man mops up
ooh, lbw appeal. Length ball, swinging into the left-hander, who plays across it from the crease, looking for midwicket, and misses. Going down the leg side, though
Amla's racing away here, and he's being helped by some ordinary Sri Lankan bowling. Low full-toss outside off stump, and he squeezes it away to the right of backward point
full outside off and Amla drives with an open face again, this time to the left of backward point. Lakmal has to put in the dive after sprinting to his right from third man
shortish, angling in towards off stump. Jumps to ride the bounce and defends into the point region
quick, sharp bouncer over off stump - 87mph. Amla leans away from the line to evade it
good ball. Good length outside off, and Amla looks for the on-the-up cover drive. Nips in slightly, and rolls away into the square-leg region off the inside edge
another short ball, this time a little more outside off. Amla leans back and looks to uppercut, but can't connect
play and miss. Back of a length outside off, and this nips in and keeps slightly low to beat the inside edge as QdK looks to punch into the covers without moving his feet
short, angling into the batsman's waist. Tucked away to long leg
big appeal as Lakmal gets this to nip back in and defeat Amla's attempted flick. He was on the back foot, and struck on the back leg, but the ball probably pitched too short to be hitting the stumps
shortish, a bit of width, cut away to the right of third man
back of a length, angling into the body, clipped to midwicket
full, angling into the pads, and de Kock misses out, flicking this straight to midwicket
short on off stump and this one sits up - none of the steep bounce we've seen so far - and Amla swivels to pull it away to the backward square leg boundary
short again, a little further outside off, and Amla puts this away even more brilliantly, getting up off his toes and using his wrists to whip it away to the same backward square-leg boundary
now he goes full and wide, and Amla flows into a beautiful drive, into the gap between cover point and extra-cover

back of a length close to off stump. Jumps up and looks to whip it into the leg side. The bounce ensures he can't play it to midwicket as intended, so he ends up keeping it down defensively, towards the non-striker
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg

gone! De Kock has looked uneasy so far, and he gets out to a poor shot. A good length ball slanting across him. It's around the line of off stump when he meets it, looking to hit it against the angle over mid-on. Ends up getting a big edge on it, and man at backward point takes the high catch, backtracking and running to his right
some outswing from a good length outside off, left alone
overpitched, and Reeza is off the mark with a lovely drive to the left of cover point
back of a length outside off, punched hard into the ground and it bounces up over the jumping backward point fielder
back of a length, close to off stump with some outswing. Left alone
good ball. Angling in from a little wider on the crease and leaving Hendricks from the fifth-stump line. He thinks about defending, then changes his mind and leaves at the last moment. Good carry too
back of a length, a little wider, and Hendricks plays and misses, slashing uncertainly, looking for the late cut
short and wide and Amla is a little late on his back-foot slap. Good pace from Kumara there. Ends up hitting it in the air, but on the bounce, to third man, off the toe end of the bat
shortish, angling in to cramp Hendricks as he gets on his toes to try and punch into the covers. Ends up defending it instead
full, angling into off and middle. Clipped to mid-on
shot! But no runs, a back-of-a-length ball offering some width, and he punches forcefully but straight to Akila at cover point
short now, angling into off stump. Hits the inside half of the bat as he defends off the back foot and they pick up a quick single as the ball rolls gently into the leg side
shortish outside off, jumps across and dabs it to third man
length ball in the fourth-stump channel with a bit of gentle shape away. Left alone
back of a length, slightly wider. Amla leaves again
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off, defended to backward point with soft hands
fuller now, not quite full enough for the forceful drive. Gets on the front foot for the checked drive to mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, punched to extra-cover
tossed up outside off, the offbreak first up, defended to short extra-cover
nice flight, a little wider, gets a positive stride in to drive against the turn, to the left of the diving extra-cover fielder
looped up once more, closer to off stump this time, stretches out to defend it back to the bowler

shot! Down the track, lovely quick feet as he sees some flight once again, on off stump. Makes a bit of room to hit it back over the bowler's head. Didn't look to hit that too hard, just lovely flow of his hands
short now, on off stump, and he rocks back to cut it away to the left of the diving cover point fielder. Brings up his fifty as well. Super innings so far
good length now, just outside off. Gets on the front foot and clips with the turn to midwicket

back of a length close to off stump. Barely any width but Hendricks doesn't need too much. Perhaps the shot of the match so far, and shows how good this pitch is to bat on. A half-step forward, and a straight-bat punch to the right of backward point

ooh, doesn't carry to slip. Back of a length, gets it to straighten away in the channel. Jabs at it with a slightly open face, and the edge falls just short of Kusal Mendis at slip. He seems to have hurt his finger, the physio has come onto the field
back of a length, angling into leg stump, tucked away to the left of long leg
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and steers it down to third man
length ball angling into off stump. Stays in the crease and blocks into the covers
back of a length on off stump. Hendricks uses the inward angle to clip to mid-on
carrom ball, on off and middle. Goes deep in his crease to defend it back down the pitch
flighted offbreak on off stump, whipped down to long-on
loopy full-toss outside off and Hendricks misses out. Drives it powerfully but straight to short extra
continues to toss it up, but the length is too full. This one's a half-volley on off stump and Hendricks makes a bit of room to drive inside-out to the left of the diving extra-cover fielder
full, angling into the pads. Looks to flick and misses and is hit low on the pad, well outside leg stump
quicker one, on middle stump. Goes back and works it to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face and dabs to backward point
full outside off, possibly a slower one. Looks to drive away from his body and gets a thickish inside edge that rolls to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, defended to mid-on
full, lots of width, but there's a man back at deep point to minimise the cost of such deliveries
back of a length outside off, slapped to deep point
ooh, extra bounce. Beats Amla's outside edge as he aims an angled-bat punch at one in the corridor. Misread the length too - it was slightly short of a good length and he was on the front foot
full now, and he opens his bat face to steer it down to third man
bouncer, and that beats everybody. Rises steeply over off stump and keeps climbing. Reeza leaves it and Dickwella, airborne with both arms upraised, has no chance of stopping it
short outside off, pulled to deep square leg, slightly to the fielder's left
full, angling into off stump, driven to mid-on
another bouncer, again rises over head high. Amla can't connect with the hook
shortish outside off, Amla plays a short-arm jab tp deep midwicket
back of a length, angling into off stump and denying the batsman width. Defended back towards the bowler
onto the pads now, clipped away to long leg
back of a length, a bit of offcut on this, jags in and would have missed leg stump. Amla misses the flick and the ball rolls into the leg side off the thigh pad
length ball on off stump and the angle undoes Hendricks' attempt to push into the covers. Hits inside edge and then pad
a bit of width now, full, and he hits it in the air, on the bounce to the right of deep point
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and looks to run it down to third man. Can't beat backward point, however
length ball angling into Amla's body. Defended firmly off the front foot

short outside off, and Amla comfortably pulls off the back foot with the delivery's natural angle. Well hit, but deep backward square manages to get his body behind that. Shehan Jayasuriya was the man there, and he gets a cheer from the crowd for his effort
back of a length outside off, and he stands tall to punch through to deep point for a walking single
length ball outside off, and angling in sharly on this occasion. Forces an error from Amla, who misses out on the leg-side flick. Hits his stomach and flies away to the off side
length ball outside off, and Amla whips this off his hips to deep midwicket
back of a length, but wide outside off. Allows him to throw his hands at it, and he slashes a punch to deep point once again
full just outside off, and he can't drive through the ball's line. Deceived by the change of pace, and Amla almost pays the price. Plays it uppishly, and almost carries to the bowler
full outside off, and comfortably driven off the front foot to the square fielder in the deep
good length on middle, and clipped off his hips to the fielder at fine leg. Hendricks continuing to rotate the strike
extra bounce outside off, forcing the batsman to tiptoe and defend back to Perera

offcutter on off stump, and the ball comes into Amla as he misses the pull. The delivery goes under his bat, and hits him near the knee roll. Appeal for lbw, and given! But Amla reviews. Replays show it hit the back leg. No bat either. Time for ball-tracking... and that's missing! Amla survives. Extra bounce saving him on this occasion.

gets him next ball! Deceived by the offcutter once again. Same delivery as the last ball, and Amla tries to drive straight on this occasion. But the ball, it jags in sharply, goes between bat and pad, and clips then the top of off stump as Sri Lanka roar with delight. What a delivery. Completely owns Amla. Goes for a well-made half-century at a strike-rate of 100.
full on off, and pushed to cover off the front foot
pitched just outside off, and Hendricks goes onto the back foot. Steers it past the point fielder to the deep
full on off, and Faf takes a big stride forward. Drives to the extra cover fielder near the deep
tossed up on off, and he shovels a straight drive to long off for one
full on leg stump, and flicked to square leg off the front foot
length ball on off, and he rocks back to punch with the angled bat. Another single to the sweeper fielder in the deep
unconvincing! But he'll collect the double. Attempted straight drive for the full ball, but Hendricks' bat turned in his hand, therefore taking the shot past midwicket instead
full just outside off, and Hendricks is careful because of Thisara's variations. Comes forward and defends with soft hands
back of a length on off, and he stands tall to pull square! But the shot has been drilled straight to deep backward square
slower ball outside off. Lands on a length, and Faf goes forward to tap it towards cover
full just outside off, and he gets onto the front foot to drive. Pinned staight to mid off
full on off, and that's been nudged to the vacant midwicket region. He calls early for the second run too, and it could be close but the throw doesn't hit the non-striker's stumps
full on oeg stump, and down he goes - on one knee - to sweep to the fielder in the deep
full on middle, and defended to the fielder at short midwicket
full just outside off, but Faf uses his feet to get to the pitch of the delivery. Executes a solid drive to wide long off
slower in the air, as it lands just on middle stump. Hendricks comes forward to block towards the off side
full and wide outside off, but Hendricks is done playing! Goes down on one knee, slog sweeps from outside the stumps, and sends this over the cow-corner boundary! Moves on to 44.
full outside leg stump, and Hendricks shovels a check-drive down to long on. He'll keep strike
full on off, and once again a slower-than-usual delivery from Thisara. Flicked to deep midwicket for two
almost played on! Full on off and Hendricks' atttempted front-foot defense takes a inside edge and runs down to third man
full outside off, and that's a fifty on ODI debut! Comfortably tapped to cover as he raises his bat to the dressing room. David Miller gives him a standing ovation
back of a length outside off, and Faf comes down the ground. He's in an awkward position, as his attempted push to cover goes to the leg side instead
back of a length outside off, and guided off the back foot to point
back of a length on middle. But with the lack of pace, all Faf can do is whip it off his hips to fine leg
ful on off, and Faf looked like he was winding up for a big shot. But adjusts late, and drives down to long off instead
full outside off, and Hendricks is in no position to cut. But he goes for the shot anyway, and manages to squirt a top-edged cut past point for a couple
full on leg stump, and Hendricks uses the angled bat to push towards cover
good length outside off, and punched to cover. Stopped by the diving fielder, but he can't stop the single
full on off, and the attempted defensive shot towards cover goes to the leg side instead
full on leg stump, and defended past the bowler's left to long off. Enough time to walk across for one
back of a length outside off, and cut away hard in front of square! Work for the man in the deep, but Kusal Perera manages to dive and stop the ball from going for four
back of a length outside off, and he runs this down to third man for a single
short on off, and Faf sways away from the line of the delivery

holes out! Back of a length on off, and too short for Faf to attempt to whip off his pads. But he does so anyway, and it comes off the bat's inside half. In the air for a while, and Lakmal at deep midwicket makes no mistake
short ball, and Hendricks' attempted pull doesn't come off! Flies over the bat as keeper and bowler appeal in unison for caught behind. The umpire smiles it off
back of a length on off, and clipped off his hips to deep midwicket. A couple more
full outside off, and driven with the angled bat to the offside. Takes the outside edge and runs down to third man for a brace
full just outside off, and driven to mid off for a quick single
good length outside off, and he rocks back onto the backfoot. Punched to deep extra cover
full just outside off, and that's been chipped over the bowler's head. Long on intercepts
good length outside off, and the cut has been inside-edged through the keeper's legs! Unlucky for SL, but Duminy won't mind how these runs come.
length ball on middle, but JP comes down the ground and converts it into a low full toss. Drives to long on
good length outside off, and angling across Duminy. Tries to defend, but the inside edge almost ensures he chops on! Luckily for Duminy, the ball bounces over the stumps
full on off, and driven through the line to mid off. Straight to the fielder though
aimed at his pads, and Duminy has no trouble whipping this away to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
full on off, and the front-foot defense is played to short mid on
back of a length outside off, and the attempted punch comes off the bat's top half. Rolls away to mid off
full just outside off, and defended to cover
full just outside off, and defended to cover off the front foot for a single
full outside leg stump, but he misses out on the sweep. Hits his front leg, but impact was obviously outside
full on leg stump, and nudged away to the leg side for a single
full on leg stump, and he top-edges a slog sweep! Could be out if deep backward square can intercept in time, but he can't get there, and the ball rolls away to the boundary for four
full on middle and leg. Turning into his pads, and defended to the leg side
full outside leg stump, and that's been played fine, Flicked off his pads past the keeper, and short fine leg has to give it a mighty chase
good length outside off, and he rides the bounce to steer this delivery to third man
full just outside off, and driven to extra cover for a single
back of a length outside off, and pulled away with ease! Played along the ground, and this beats the fielder placed in the deep
good length on middle stump, and defended to cover off the front foot
full on off, and pushed to cover off the front foot once again. Keeping things tight
full just outside off, and driven with the ball angling away. But commitment on display from Mathews as he dives to his left - at cover - and stops the ball from going through
full just outside off, and going straight through. Hendricks uses his wrists to nudge this to square leg
full on middle, and he takes a big stride forward to defend
good length on off, and turning away after pitching. Cut to point
full on middle, but the ball stays pretty low. Hendricks uses the depth of his crease to work it off his pads to the leg side
good length on middle, and punched off the back foot to deep extra cover
half-tracker on middle, and Hendricks has no trouble in slogging a pull to the leg side. Man in the deep though, so a comfortable double on offer for SA
full just outside off, and Duminy misses out on the drive. Hit straight to cover

But not given. They are not reviewing though. It was full on leg stump, and he misses the defensive shot off the front foot. The ball sneaks inside his bat, but replays suggest it was bat-pad, which saved him
slogged! Down on one knee, and meets this full ball under his eyes, and drags a sweep from outside off, and into the cow-corner boundary
good length on middle, and he comes forward to defend. But the ball hits his front leg
yorker outside off, and he wedges a drive onto his boots. Ouch!
good length outside off, and he misses the flick off his pads. Hits his front leg, but the ball would've missed leg stump
length ball on middle, and spinning into his pads. Flicked away to deep midwicket
good length on leg stump, and nudged away behind square for another single
full just outside off, and swept away with ease! Picks the length early, and drags this with the spin, and into the mid-wicket boundary
full on leg stump, and pushed to point for a single
full ball on off, and defended to cover

what's happened here? They're all confused. Akila appeals for caught behind, but Dickwella doesn't go up. Did he inside-edge a cut onto his boots and then into the keeper's gloves? Or was it ground first? Hmm, the umpire calls over though
full outside leg stump, and worked off his toes to deep midwicket for a single
good length on middle, and angling into JP. Defended back to the bowler
angling across his pads, and Duminy clips this away to the vacant mid-wicket region for a single
full on leg stump, and pushed off his pads to midwicket for another comfortable run
full on middle, and punched with the angle to short mid on
full on middle, but Duminy's drive forces him to york himself. Hits the toe of his bat, eventually rolling back to the bowler
length ball outside off, and clipped off his pads to midwicket
full on middle, and driven down the ground to long on for one
full on off, and he comes forward to defend. Back to Akila
legspinner on middle stump, but Hendricks uses the depth of the crease to clip away to the legside
full on leg stump, but Duminy opens his stance and drills a drive down to long off
tossed up on middle stump, and worked to deep midwicket for another single
full on leg stump, and once again nudged to the vacant infield on the leg side
full just outside off, and driven to wide long off for one.
full outside off, and swept to deep midwicket. Two men converging there, and they nearly collided!
length ball on leg stump, and he - once again - works it to the leg-side
good length on off, and Duminy punches down the ground to long off

full outside leg stump, and that's been placed beautifully between long on and deep midwicket. Gets to the pitch of the ball, and uses his wrists to time this to perfection over midwicket. Where's the action replay?
slides this across, outside off, and there isn't much turn back. Beats Duminy's attempted reverse-sweep
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
down the track and he doesn't quite reach the pitch of this flat one angled across him. Clips it back to the bowler
flighted ball on off stump, presses forward and pushes into the gap between backward point and short cover
flat and fairly full, angled into middle and leg. Defended back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, not much turn. Goes deep in his crease to work it through the leg side
short outside off, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length on the pads, tucked away to deep square leg

shortish, a bit of width, and that's a terrific shot! Stands tall on his toes and punches it away, effortlessly, to the left of the diving short extra-cover fielder. The sweeper at deep point was too square to be able to run around and cut it off

and that's the hundred - the fastest by an ODI debutant! What an innings! Back of a length, angling into his legs, and he tucks it away neatly, well into the gap to the left of the man at long leg. He's been middling it right from the time he walked in, and he's flowed on unimpeded right since

and then he's beaten by an absolute ripper. Where were you all along, Lahiru Kumara? Back of a length, jags back in sharply from just outside off, beats the inside edge of his attempted defensive push - his feet went nowhere because the length was just perfect - and it just about flicked the top of the leg bail
back of a length, slanting across the left-hander. Miller is opened up as he defends into the off side
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point. And Lakmal has overstepped - tight, but a definite no-ball
full on off stump, driven down to long-off. Why didn't he go harder at that?
shortish outside off, stops on Miller slightly as he looks to slap it square. Ends up having to adjust and play it to mid-off instead
good bouncer, slanting across and rising over off stump. Sways his upper body quickly away from the line
fullish on middle and leg, clipped to mid-on
length ball slanting away from off stump. Good stride forward for a push to sweeper cover
shortish outside off, and that's beautiful timing, stands tall, opens his bat face, and just steers that to the boundary to the left of the helpless third man fielder
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, misses the flick and is hit high on the thigh pad
on the pads, clipped to deep square leg
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
shortish on off stump. Looks to pull and ends up bottom-edging towards short fine leg
length ball pitching outside leg and angling into the stumps. Looks to flick and misses, and Kumara aborts his lbw appeal quickly
full outside off, driven to mid-off
full outside off, driven to deep point
back of a length, slanting away from off stump. Shuffles across to work it through square leg
back of a length, close to off stump, punched to deep point
good ball, in the blockhole close to off stump. Blocked into the on side
back of a length, close to off stump. Looks to punch into the gap between short extra and mid-off, and the former fielder throws himself to his left to stop the ball
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and chops it to third man
full on off stump, clipped away to deep square leg

down the track and he gets exactly the line he wants. It's on his pads, on a length, and he whips it away in the air, but into the gap to the left of deep square leg. Looked like the fielder there - Lakmal - was a little late picking it up, and didn't move to his left quickly enough
slower ball, back of a length, pulled to long leg

ooh, nearly another wicket. Fullish, slanting away from off stump, but not quite full enough for the drive. Has to reach for it, and ends up spooning it in the air, but he finds the tiniest of gaps between the diving fielders at short extra-cover and mid-off
on the pads now and Miller flicks it away gratefully into the huge vacant spaces to the right of deep square leg
short, rising ball on off stump. Gets on his toes and chops it down by his feet. Wanted to play that towards backward point, I think, but didn't get the connection he wanted
starts with a wide, fired down the leg side. Duminy can't connect with the pull
fuller now, on leg stump, swept firmly along the ground to deep square leg
length ball angling into middle and leg, clipped into the square leg region
tossed up fairly wide of off stump, good work with the bottom hand to drag that sweep to the right of deep square leg
floated up wide of off, driven to the left of sweeper cover to bring up his second fifty of the series and the 27th of his career. He's looking properly dangerous now
full at Duminy's feet, clipped to short fine leg
tossed up slower, on a good length on leg stump. Defended with the turn into the covers
full on middle stump, driven to long-off
shuffles across his stumps and out of his crease now. Clips this middle-stump ball into the fine leg region
length ball outside off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on
length ball sliding on towards leg stump. Looks to drive down the ground, playing for turn, and it takes his inside edge and rolls to backward square leg
tossed up on middle and leg. Stretches out low and reverse-paddles through backward point
good length on leg stump, clipped watchfully into the on side
sees Miller stepping across and bowls one quicker at his pads. Clipped to deep backward square leg
down the track and Akila shifts his line wider. Driven to sweeper cover

big appeal - he was sweeping from the stumps - and Llong says not-out. Did that straighten enough to be hitting the stumps? Sri Lanka have reviewed this... Nope, doesn't matter where that was going, because Miller got a bit of glove on it first
back of a length, turns from middle to off. Goes deep in his crease to whip this to long-on. Only three from the over, not a whole lot of ambition from these two batsmen barring that missed sweep

shot. That was fairly quick and fairly full outside off, and he gets down low in a flash and brings quick hands into play to sweep powerfully past deep midwicket, who didn't have a long way to move to his left
fullish outside off, defended into the covers
full on off, steps out and clips to midwicket
length ball on off stump, and Miller opens up his front leg and gets down low to slog-sweep along the ground, this time to the right of deep midwicket
another slider, going down leg. Miller is cramped for room as he tries to work it leg-side, and is hit on the back leg
length ball sliding on towards off stump. Makes a bit of room and squeezes it to the right of cover, who makes a good sprawling stop
quick and full outside off, and Duminy aims a reverse-sweep at it. Doesn't make contact, but does enough to unsight the keeper, and the ball runs away for four byes
slower outside off, swept to deep midwicket
low full-toss on middle stump, driven to long-on

shot. There's that slog-sweep again. Makes hitting room by getting his front leg out of the way, and he needed all that room because it was pretty full. Then he gets down low and launches it high over wide long-on
well done. Akila saw him switch hands for the switch-hit and bowled it wide of off (leg) stump. Sweeps it over the man at short third man and picks up four more
full, on the stumps, clips it, looking for long-on, and the bowler moves quickly to field it
on the pads, clipped to the left of deep midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, tucked off the hip to the left of deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, clipped gently to the right of deep midwicket. No one in the circle in front of square on the leg side
short, close to off stump, pulled to the right of deep midwicket, where Dhananjaya stretches out his right hand to stop it
length ball slanting away from off stump. Shuffles across and misses the flick and the ball rolls off his back pad to the left of the diving keeper
short on off stump and that's a fortuitous boundary for Duminy. Goes hard at this pull, and bottom-edges it to the left of the man at short fine leg
shortish on off stump. Chopped into the backward point region for a quick single

in the blockhole - a low, dipping full-toss, actually -  on leg stump and that's dragged away for another four. Clears his front leg and swipes hard at it, and the bottom edge races away to the right of long leg
down the track, giving himself room, and he lifts this leg-stump length ball just out of reach of the leaping cover fielder. That brings up South Africa's 300
full-toss on the pads, and that's a bad ball. Clears his front leg and just whips it away to the left of deep square leg
short on off stump and he clubs it away. Clears his front leg and clears the midwicket boundary with ease to move into the 90s
slower ball on off stump. Makes a bit of room and carves it to the right of the fielder at deep point. 23 off that over
length ball slanting away from off stump. Lofts it to the left of the fielder at sweeper cover, and the fielder just about cuts it off with a sliding save
slower ball, full outside off. Shuffles across and clips to deep midwicket

full outside off, and Duminy misses out on a hundred. A splendid innings comes to an end, as he steps across his stumps and looks to swing this over the leg side. May have wanted to go a little squarer, but it was a slightly off-pace ball from Thisara, and he ends up hitting it straight down the throat of deep midwicket
low full-toss, slanting away from off stump. Opens his bat face and steers to third man
short, shoulder-high ball on off stump, leans away to make a bit of room, and Phehlukwayo is off the mark with a boundary. Just opens his bat face and steers it to the right of third man
back of a length on middle and leg, worked away to deep backward square leg
flat, angling into the pads, worked to short fine leg
very full on leg stump, jabbed back to the bowler
a bit slower now, still quite full on middle stump. Swept to deep backward square leg
length ball on middle stump and Phehlukwayo can't beat short third man with his reverse-sweep. Not enough pace on that ball from Dananjaya
fuller, driven to long-off

a great over from Dananjaya. Sees Miller looking to step out and fires it at his feet, from a round-arm angle. Can only squeeze it down the ground, to the right of long-on. Jammed it into the ground and it bounced over the non-striker and umpire
big appeal for lbw, and that isn't given. Very full, on or just outside leg stump, and Miller plays all around it. Pitched just outside leg, I think
wide half-volley, and Miller plays a flat-bat drive, in the air, to the left of sweeper cover. Poor delivery
slower length ball on off stump, and Miller clears his front leg, waits, and whips it away over square leg. This is his 11th ODI fifty

low full-toss on off stump, and Miller picks out deep midwicket. Clears his front leg, but can't get the leverage to get the elevation he wants. Dhananjaya takes a good catch, moving backwards, at just around head height

full on off stump and Phehlukwayo puts it away, though perhaps not where he wants. Makes room to hit it over the covers, I think. Ends up getting a thick edge that runs away between backward point and short third man
length ball on off stump, slapped away hard to the left of sweeper cover
short outside off, carrom ball, slapped to deep point
shot! Phehlukwayo has been brilliant so far, very decisive with what he wants to do. Low full-toss on middle stump and he reverse-sweeps over backward point
a bit slower now and Phehlukwayo is out of his crease in a flash to launch it high over long-on. Made a lot of room, and Akila couldn't do anything about it, even as he tried to fire it down leg
quicker one, ends up sliding it down the leg side
full on off stump, doesn't quite get to the pitch with his lofted drive and ends up chipping on the bounce to sweeper cover
full on the stumps, whipped to deep square leg
sees Phehlukwayo looking to make room and fires it wide outside off stump - too wide. Keeper fumbles and they run a bye as well
now he bowls a wide outside off stump to the right-hander too. This is really difficult, a spinner bowling the last over against a rampant side
finally, lands one in the blockhole. Looks to clear his front leg and whip it away, only manages a thick inside edge into his front leg
length ball angling across off, left alone
back of a length on leg stump, cramping Tharanga for room. Flicks to midwicket to get off the mark
almost played on! Nagging length outside off, and his attempted punch takes the inside edge to fine leg
back of a length on off, and takes the top of his pads before going through to the keeper. Appeal for lbw but it bounced way too much
full and wide outside off, and going further away. Looked like a wide, but not given by the umpire
full just outside off, and through to the keeper's gloves. Left alone by Tharanga. That's the end of the first over
length ball outside leg stump, but cramping Dickwella for room. Mistimed to the off side
length ball on middle, and defended off the front foot. Played to the leg side this time
back of a length on middle, and he opens his bat's face to run it down to point. Three dots
full outside off, and driven on the up past cover! First boundary of the innings as it races away to the fence
yorker just outside off, but Dickwella manages to shovel this back to the bowler off the front foot. Tried to drive through cover though

length ball outside off, and he comes down the wicket before driving - off the bat's toe end - past cover point! The fielder there dives to take a catch, but he can't get his fingertips to it, and that's the over's second four
length ball outside off, and cut away off the back foot. Straight to point
good length on leg stump, and Tharanga taps this towards the midwicket region for a quick single
good length on middle, and the ball's angling away from the left hander. He sticks his bat out and steers this rising delivery to deep point
back of a length on middle, and defended off the back foot. Cramped for space
full outside off, and driven firmly off the front foot. But mid off's there, so they settle for a single
pace! Raw pace from Rabada. Short ball on leg stump, and the ball's gone past Dickwella even before he could prepare to pull
full outside off, and he throws his hands at this. Cuts it hard, but drops just in front of Miller at point
full on off, and lifted over the infield! Goes all the way beyond the long-off boundary. Sexy shot!
drops his length this time. Lands on middle and pushed to cover for a quick single
straight to short cover! Faf makes no mistake. Full on off, and the drive pops into the infielder's hands. A couple of feet on either side and that would've been a boundary
slogs across the line! No time wasting from Perera here. Full on off, and struck over the long-on boundary. Boom!
good length on middle stump, and tapped to the leg side off the back foot. They scamper across for one. An entertaining over comes to a close
full just outside off, and check-driven off the front foot. Almost pierces the gap, but Hendricks' dive at cover point stops the boundary
full on middle, and that's a check-drive over mid on! Just a simple follow through of the bat, and Tharanga sends this into the wide boundary on the leg side
good length on middle, and he opens his bat's face to steer this down to third man
full outside off, and he pins a straight drive to mid off. No run
back of a length on middle, but he defends the rising ball from near his face
full on off, and the on-drive takes a leading edge and goes past cover instead! Enough time to come back for a couple
full outside off, and lifted with the angle over cover! Just past Duminy's outstretched hands, and off he goes to give it a chase
good length on middle, but the slower ball has been picked by Tharanga. Pulls over the infield, but the shot doesn't have enough behind it to go for four

soft! Off the bat's top half and Sri Lanka have now lost both openers. Short ball on middle, and the pull goes straight to square leg. Easiest of catches as Tharanga checks his bat's face on the way back to the pavillion
full on off, and defended off the front foot to mid off
edged past the slip cordon! Safely through to third man. A short ball outside off, for which the batsman stuck his bat out
full on off, but he's smashed this through the ball's line. Except, the shot comes off the bat's toe end, and somehow manages to clear mid off
back of a length on off, and Mendis ducks under this ball's line
length ball angling in, and nudged away to the leg side off his hips
good length on middle, and worked off his pads to the leg side
good length outside off, and the leg-side clip takes a leading edge to third man
good length on middle, and Perera comes forward to defend through to mid off
good length on middle, and pulled to fine leg

length ball outside off. KP is a little early on his attempted cover drive, and the bottom hand takes over. Ends up dragging it down the ground, past the diving bowler and between him and the non-striker

and again! Short this time, outside off. Goes hard and too early at the back-foot slap, and ends up flat-batting it down the ground, into the same gap between the bowler and the non-striker. This time, in fact, Mendis has to duck at the other end to avoid the ball
back of a length on leg stump, worked away through square leg
short, rising ball gets up to shoulder-height, just outside off. KP looks to hook against the angle, can't quite middle it, but keeps it down into the square-leg region
length ball on off stump and KM goes after it. Opens up and slogs it over mid-off
slower ball, full and fairly wide outside off, left alone
short ball, but he's cramped for space. Mistimes a pull to the leg side
angling into his pads, and nudged off the back foot to long leg

length ball on middle, and he tries to muscle this into the leg side. But the ball was too close for the pull, and he's sliced it in the air. It's a skyer and Shamsi gets under it at mid on, but drops the ball, much to the fans' delight
length ball outside off, and Perera stands tall to slap this past cover! Some power

slow finger of death! But Perera wants to review. Has a chat with his partner, and asks for it. Was a length ball outside off, but angling into his pads, and hitting him on the back leg in front of middle stump. What does the replay say? It says 'umpire's call' with the ball clipping the top of leg stump. The decision stands, and Perera must go back!
length ball outside off, and punched through to the fielder at mid off to get off the mark
back of a length outside off, and he defends off the back foot. Mulder coming around the wicket to Thisara
angling down leg, and Perera has no trouble flicking this fine past the keeper's left! Beats short fine leg too
wide outside off, Thisara tries to cut it away, but the ball stays slightly low and sneaks under his bat. Through to QdK on the bounce.
full on middle, and that's a picture perfect straight drive down the ground for a boundary. Just to mid off's left

short outside off, and Perera tries to pull. Drags it from outside off, and it's in the air for ages. Faf is getting under it from square leg, but his diving effort is not good enough! But what's worse is that Faf may have injured his right shoulder. Out comes the physio...
full outside off, but through to the keeper with the batsman missing the drive. Mulder takes a fall on the pitch, but he looks okay
full and wide outside off, and Thisara goes for an expansive drive. He misses, and the umpire calls it a wide
good length on middle, and nudged off his hips to long leg. Enough time to jog back for two
good length outside off, and he defends firmly off the front foot. Played to mid off
good length just outside off, and punched back to mid off. Another dot
good length outside off again, and Perera blocks off the back foot. Played to cover on this occasion
back of a length outside off, and Thisara ducks away. But the ball doesn't bounce much, and therefore goes to the keeper at chest height
full outside off, and he swings through the ball's line. Chipped over mid off, and Duminy gives it a mighty chase
full on middle, and pushed to mid on for a quick single
good length on middle, and pulled along the ground to the deep midwicket boundary

slower ball on leg stump, and going down the leg side. Was there an edge though? QdK and Mulder think so. They're reviewing. And the South Africans were right! Spike off the UltraEdge when the ball passes the bat. Umpire Llong must change the decision! Amla and Miller also had a chat with the bowler before they went up for the review.
full on middle stump, and defended to the leg side
good length outside off, and tapped to cover off the back foot. No run on offer though
full outside off, and driven away from his body. But off the bat's toe end as it dribbles away to cover
full on middle stump, but going down the leg side. The umpire spreads his arms wide
slower ball! Lands just outside off, but Mendis remains patient. Defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, but angling into Mendis. Takes a giant stride forward and defends
good length outside off, and that's been beautifully cut past the fielder at point. Work for Ngidi at wide third man, but he manages to intercept
full on middle, and worked away - off his pads - to the fielder at cow corner
good length outside off, and tapped back to the bowler off the back foot
full just outside off, and defended to mid on with soft hands for a quick single
full on middle, and the straight drive comes off the bat's inside half. Rolls away to mid on instead
good length outside off, and Mathews backs away to drive through the covers. Gets a good connecton too, but Hendricks - the debutant - puts in a diving stop to slow the ball down
full on off, and the front-foot defense takes a leading edge to mid on. Keeps Mulder and co. interested
good length outside off, but Mendis opens his bat's face, and guides this down to third man for a jogging single
full on leg stump, and flicked off his pads to long leg. Another single added to sri Lanka's total
slower ball, but full outside off. He muscles a drive to mid on, but can't make the most of it
yorker on leg stump, and shoveled over to mid off
good length outside off, and punched to mid off once more
good length on middle, and worked away to the leg side
length ball down the leg side. So wide that Mathews doesn't even bother chasing
length ball on off, but he comes down the ground - converting it into a fuller ball - before chipping this over the long-on boundary. Mathews means business!
good length on leg stump, and he swivels to pull! Placed perfectly to the right of the fine-leg fielder
full just outside off, and pushed to mid on off the front foot
fullish outside off, driven to the left of mid-off. Was in the air briefly
back of a length outside off, pushed to the left of mid-off
back of a length, a little wider. Looks to play that through point, I think, with an open face, and ends up edging it to third man
back of a length on off stump, defended to backward point
length ball on off stump. Calls for one after clipping this towards mid-on, but Mathews isn't interested and he has to turn back. Would have been risky in any case
shot. Shortish outside off and he leans back, waits, and chops it to the left of the diving backward point fielder. Third man runs around to tidy up
full outside off. Wants to drive this through cover, ends up playing a little early and hitting it towards long-on instead, off the inside half of the bat
full outside off, defended to short cover
shot! Length ball close to off stump and he stands there, waits, and clatters it away between extra-cover and mid-off, flat-batting it at the top of its bounce
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and guides to third man
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg

short outside off, gets up to shoulder height. Keeps his pull down, but in the process of rolling his wrists over ends up not getting the power he'd like on the shot, and midwicket moves quickly to his right to stop it

back of a length outside off. Stops on Mathews a little as he tries to punch into the covers, ends up playing it back towards the bowler. Maybe he needs to get more side-on to play that through the off side
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
back of a length again, a bit of away movement after pitching. Defended into the covers
back of a length on off stump. Shuffles across and clips to the right of midwicket
steeply rising bouncer outside off, Mendis can't put bat to it as he tries to ramp it over the keeper
dug in short again, this time it gets up just over Mendis's right shoulder. He pulls it in the air, but on the bounce to deep square leg
back of a length, turning into the pads, tucks it to the left of backward square leg
fuller now, on leg stump, gets on the front foot to clip to deep midwicket
tossed up on off stump now, offers a little more swinging room. Mendis clears his front leg slightly and slog-sweeps to the left of deep midwicket
full on off stump, clipped to long-on
flatter length ball on middle and off, comes forward to defend with the turn into the on side
length ball on middle and off, possibly the googly. Mathews blocks it back to the bowler
short outside off, just gets up to chest height, and Mendis pulls it away confidently, to the left of deep square leg
length ball close to off stump, defended back to the bowler

short again, this one's banged in harder and rises over shoulder-high. Mendis goes for the pull again, and has to drag it from outside off as well. Can't keep it down, and Mulder takes an excellent low catch running in from the square-leg boundary. End of a promising innings
back of a length, slides this down the leg side, and de Silva can't connect with the flick off the hip. Sri Lanka's more famous de Silva loved that shot
slower length ball outside off and de Silva doesn't pick the change of pace. Presses forward to defend and the ball goes past his outside edge and bounces again before reaching the keeper
short, angling down the leg side. Another wide as de Silva misses the pull
fullish outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across to clip to midwicket
floated up slow outside off, driven to long-off
dips onto a good length on off stump, defended with the turn to midwicket
back of a length, turning from middle to leg. Goes deep in his crease to work it to long leg, past the diving leg gully fielder
tossed up fuller, stretches out to clip it back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to long-off
short, googly spinning away from off stump, slapped away to deep point
shortish, a bit of inward movement towards off stump. No room for an attacking shot and de Silva defends into the off side
short on middle stump, pulled to long leg
fullish outside off, can't time his drive and it rolls slowly to short cover
nicely timed, but too close to the fielder. Length ball, a bit of width, and Mathews drives on the up with an open face, and backward point moves quickly to his right to stop it
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Mathews misses the flat-bat square drive, and Nigel Llong doesn't signal wide but possibly thought about it
short, angling into off and middle, pulled round to deep square leg
shortish outside off, slapped to the left of backward point
on the pads, clipped to short fine leg
back of a length, turns in towards leg stump. Steps across and tucks it to short fine leg
slower now, more flight, on middle stump. Looks to drive inside-out, through mid-off maybe, and ends up playing too early and dragging it through midwicket with a lot of bottom hand
quicker one, not short enough to go back and whip through midwicket. Turns in quickly and hits him on the back pad, but strikes him outside the line of off stump
loopy full-toss, and Mathews is quick to get on the front foot and swipe that away, one bounce, to the midwicket boundary
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards backward point
shot! Length ball outside off, and he uses the hitting room to flat-bat that, on the up, between extra-cover and mid-off
length ball outside off, a touch shorter than the previous one. Presses forward and dabs with an open face to third man
ooh, looks for the off-stump yorker, and nearly sneaks through as Mathews makes room for the inside-out cover drive. He's lucky he makes just enough contact to dig it out back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to short cover
back of a length on off stump, clipped to deep square leg
down the track, meets this flighted off-stump ball on the full, and powers it back down the ground, into the boundary to the right of long-off
another loopy full-toss, this time wider outside off, swept hard and along the ground to deep midwicket
googly, short enough to read it off the pitch and defend in front of off stump
the stock ball, turning into his pads. Clipped to short fine leg. Sri Lanka haven't quite managed to beat that fielder yet
tossed up on leg stump, gets on the front foot and clips to midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
fullish, angling into off stump. Drives a little early, aiming for mid-off, ends up playing it to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
slower ball, shortish outside off. Pulls hard but straight to midwicket. Dhananjaya hasn't really been finding the gaps so far
short again, comes in towards middle stump. Swivels to pull to the left of long leg
full on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
short, angling way down the leg side, left alone
full on the pads, clipped away nicely and long leg has to throw himself to his right after a big sprint to cut that off. Phehlukwayo the fielder, does a fine job of keeping it down to two
back of a length on off stump, defended into the on side, with the angle
flighted and full on middle stump, jabbed back to the bowler
back of a length, turns into the pads, clipped to backward square leg

big appeal for lbw as Mathews misses the sweep. Given out, but it seemed like it might have been going down leg. Mathews turns and begins walking back before realising he can review this... Finally decides to take the review. No bat on it, let's see what ball-tracking says... pitches on about middle stump, and it's turning just enough to clip the outside of leg stump. Umpire's call, and that means Mathews will have to walk back
floated up on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
full on middle stump, defended to midwicket
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
fullish outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full on off stump, defended with the angle into the on side
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, steered past Duminy, diving left from backward point, with an open bat face
back of a length, angling into off stump. Defended from the back foot, and the ball drops down onto the batsman's left foot
back of a length outside off, and that's beautiful timing, punched with a vertical bat to the right of deep point
tossed up slow on leg stump, driven to mid-on
short, wide, slapped away to the left of backward point
full outside off, driven to long-off
tossed up slow and wide of off and Dhananjaya gets down on one knee and drives in the air, deliberately, to the left of extra-cover
floated up on off stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on leg stump, goes back and works it to deep square leg

short, angling down leg, pulled to the left of long leg and Phehlukwayo does good work, at first, to put in the diving save, before losing control of the ball and almost letting it roll to the boundary, before mopping up once more
length ball outside off, punched pleasingly on the up to deep point
back of a length on off stump. Wanted to punch that through cover, ended up hitting it back towards the bowler off the inside half of his bat
full on off stump, the angle across him gives him an extra bit of room and he uses that to free his arms and loft this over wide mid-off
length ball slanting across to off stump. Stays on the back foot to defend and gets opened up as he plays this to backward point
shortish on leg stump, worked off the hips to the right of deep square leg
tossed up on off stump, and he goes for the reverse-sweep. Not sure if that's where he wanted to place it, but it rolls off the face of his bat and nutmegs the keeper
he certainly hits this one where he wanted. Tossed up outside off and he gets forward to slog-sweep with a whip of his wrists, to the square leg boundary
and again, this time it's all along the ground. That whip of his wrists enables him to play it square, to the left of the fielder at backward square leg
back of a length, turning down leg. Tucked to short fine leg
flat length ball on leg stump, worked away through square leg
short and wide, cut away to deep point
back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and steers it to third man
length ball outside off, presses forward and guides to third man with an open face
full on middle and leg, driven to extra-cover
length ball angling into leg stump. Stops on him a little as he tries to flick, and it pops up briefly in the air towards the non-striker
bouncer outside off, Akila can't connect with the attempted ramp over the keeper
yorker angling into off stump, watches it well and jabs it out to deep point
good length on middle, and Akila backs away to carve a punch through to cover
half-tracker on leg stump, and that's been pulled off the back foot to deep mid wicket
full on middle, and he comes down the ground, before drilling a drive to long off
full on leg stump, and he sweeps to the backward square boundary. Man there though
full just outside off, and defended away towards cover
good length outside off, and it's been cut off the back foot to the sweeper fielder on the boundary
back of a length outside off, and he tiptoes before guiding this down to third man for one
short on off, and defended from near his face off the back foot

back of a length outside off, and pulled over the fielder at deep backward square! Great connection, and perhaps a bit of a top edge too. But that's what Sri Lanka need. Well, atleast ten more of them
back of a length again, and angling into Dhananjaya. Pulled along the ground to deep midwicket on this occasion
good length outside off, and Akila tries to ramp it over the keeper. Misses out on any connection though
short on middle, and forcing the batsman to duck! The umpire, though, thinks it's wide
cramped for space again, but Dananjaya manages to drop his hands on this short ball, and taps it to the leg side for one
reverse swept! But straight to short third man. Full ball on leg stump, and Dhananjaya adjusted beautifully
full on middle, and driven off the front foot to mid on
length ball outside off. Spinning away from the left-hander, and cut to point for a quick run
full on middle, and this has been worked off his toes to the vacant square leg region
full on leg stump, and he uses his wrists to whip it away to square leg. Rotating the strike as much as possible
full just outside off, and he comes down the ground to drive. Played to long on, and that's his fifty!
full outside off, and he throws his hands at it, and manages to slice a drive behind point. It races away!
length ball angling in, and he mistimes a pull to the leg side. In the air for a while, but drops short of midwicket. Done in by the slower ball on this occasion
good length outside off, and he sticks his bat out to try and ramp it fine past the keeper's right. But QdK's diving effort to his right stops the ball, and saves three runs for certain
good length outside off, and cut off the front foot. Finds point though
good length outside off, and Akila tiptoes to tap this psat the fielder at point for one
angling into his body, but he uses his wrists to whip it away to midwicket. Beats the fielder, allowing Sri Lanka to come back for the second run
tossed up on middle, and the straight drive comes off the outside of the bat. In the air, but drops just short of Rabada at short cover
full on middle, and driven to short cover once more
full on leg, and he comes dancing down the wicket, before lifting it inside-out over extra cover! Playing with a lot of heart
good length outside off, and furiously cut off the back foot. Beats forward point, but the fielder in the deep manages to intercept
full on off, and defended to short cover
back of a length on middle, but very awry from Phehlukwayo. Goes down the leg side
steered past short third man! Short and wide, and he opens his bat's face to deliberately edge this fine between the keeper and the infielder to his right
length ball wide outside off stump, but he fails to play the cut. The ball sneaks under his bat and goes to QdK on the bounce
good length on off, but once again taking the pace off the ball. Dhananjaya tries to pull, but misses the shot, and ouch, that's hit his groin!
good length outside off, and he pulls this down the ground to long on for a walking single
full on off, and he drills a drive to the leg side. Finds midwicket though. Was timed well. If only it was placed better...
well deceived slower ball, but Dhananjaya is up to the challenge. Waits for the ball to come to him, before slogging across the line to the cow-corner boundary
length ball outside off, and the ball is going further away from him. He backs away to cut, and the ball beats the fielder at point!
overpitched outside off, but Dhananjaya makes room and plays a very late past point. Chase for the fielder, but he manages to pull the ball back
full outside off, and he goes down on one knee to try and sweep. Mistimed to the fielder in the deep
full outside leg stump, but Dananjaya yorks himself by coming down the ground. Shoveled to short cover
full outside off, and he goes for a wild swing across the line. Misses completely as the ball goes through to QdK
back of a length outside off, and his attempted punch comes off the bat's toe end. Goes straight down the ground to mid on as the batsmen exchange a quick single. Sri Lanka reach 250
back of a length outside off, and he tries to flat-bat it over the bowler's head. Off the bat's toe end, and mid off makes no mistake! The momentum shifts heavily towards the visitors once again
welcomed with a slower ball outside off. Driven to mid off for a quick single
short on off, and the attempted pull is top edged over the keeper's head! They'll take that
good length on middle, and defended off the back foot
right in the gut! Length ball angling in, and he misses out on the pull. Hits his body thereafter as Lakmal whimpers away to the off side
sees the batsman coming down the ground, and he bowls it short on leg stump. Forced to nudge it to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
good length on leg stump, but spinning into his pads. Flicked off the back foot to the fine-leg fielder
full on leg stump, but spinning down the leg side
full on leg stump, but the lbw appeal is turned down! He missed the leg-side flick, but looks like the ball pitched outside leg stump. Shamsi wants to review but stand-in captain QdK shakes his head
flighted on off, and spinning into Lakmal. Defended
full on leg stump, but spinning down the leg side. Lakmal tries to work it fine, but it hits his front leg instead
full outside off, and he tees up for the big shot. But all he can do is mistime to long on. He'll keep strike
short on off, and he pulls with the delivery's angle. Straight to Mulder in the deep, but on the bounce
back of the hand slower ball, but that's been picked from the hand. He opens his stance and then thumps a cross-batted slog over deep midwicket!
good length outside off, thumped to mid off

slower ball outside off, and he launches it over extra cover! This is glorious from Dhananjaya - the lone warrior for Sri Lanka! Proper follow through of the bat, and that's his highest ever ODI score

good length outside off, but the attempted slog to the leg side does't come off. QdK holds on to it as the bowler appeals for a catch. Umpire Llong says no, but QdK is convinced. They review. Is that out? Looks like the ball went under his bat, and there's a thick under edge on UltraEdge. Oh dear, a beautiful innings comes to an end as South Africa go closer to a 3-0 lead
attempted yorker that's eventually a low full toss on leg stump. Tapped to midwicket
length ball on middle stump, and spinning into his pads. Worked down the ground to long on
full outside leg stump, and spinning further down the leg side
dream ball! Full on middle, and spinning enough to go between bat and pad! Crashes into leg stump as Jayasuriya misses the straight drive
good length outside off, but spinning further away from the left hander. Through to the keeper
full outside off, and defended off the front foot
good length on leg stump, but spins into middle and off. Fended off the back foot
good length outside off, and he goes for a big slog towards the leg side. Mistimed to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, and soaring over Kumara's shoulders. Held by the keeper from near his face
good length outside off, and fended away to cover off the back foot
good length on leg stump, and he misses the flick fine past the keeper. Hits his arm guard
very full just outside off, and defended back to Ngidi. He has a shy at the stumps, and even breaks the middle stump at the striker's end, but Kumara was always inside the crease
good length outside off, and pulled away in front of square! Duminy gives it a chase, and parries it back from wide long on
good length on middle, and Lakmal shuffles across to the off side, before slogging behind square to the fielder in the boundary
full outside off, and the attempted slog over cover is sliced! In the air, but falls in no man's land. Mid off missing
good length outside leg stump, and he opens his stance to slog tp deep midwicket
full on off, and that's been drilled! Showing the rest of his team how to bat. Clears his front leg, and thumps it to the long-on boundary
turn and bounce! Full outside off, and spinning away from the batsman, eventually going into Amla's hands at first slip
good length outside off, and punched back to the bowler off te back foot
full outside off, but Lakmal's in the mood to tee off for every ball. Clears his front leg, but the attempted slog goes to midwicket
is this it? Bowler and keeping converging, but Ngidi takes the catch! Slices this in the air and South Africa win by 78 runs!
